ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved my speaking and comprehension abilities significantly through this class. I also learned a lot more about Hispanic cultures, authors, and poets.
How to speak Spanish and read Spanish and understand Spanish
I am a more fluent Spanish speaker and writer now, and can better comprehend advanced vocabulary and ideas in Spanish.
how to speak and write better

Spanish 130 has shaped me into a more confident and comfortable Spanish speaker and writer. I have developed the critical skills to analyze works of literature and film. I have improved my reading and writing comprehension as well.
Intermediate Spanish. Finished basics of all grammar and verb tenses.
I improved my Spanish significantly in this course
I greatly improved my ability to understand and speak Spanish.
I improved in reading, listening to, and speaking Spanish.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: What made this class really special is that we focused on cultural aspects of Spanish and practiced vocab/grammar etc. via activities, movies, and books. This made the class a lot more engaging and educative than a class that focuses solely on grammar. I think this is the right way to teach a language and the Spanish department places a lot of focus on this. Daily homework, activities, and group projects also gave us a lot of chances to practice our skills every day.
It was a really good way to learn Spanish but a weakness is that the homework could have been spread out more evenly because sometimes there was a lot more in one week than another.

This class was very active and involved -- 6/7 days each week, I would be doing something in Spanish (homework, reading, writing, etc.), which helped with my Spanish capabilities. The biggest strength is the professor, who did an excellent job at keeping students engaged and accountable. This class was doable, but challenging enough to ensure that students showed up and gave it their all. Very encouraging atmosphere. The greatest weakness is the asynchronous day, which was often the least engaging and interesting day of the week.
very helpful to do in class work but there were a lot of projects that made it unclear why we were doing them

I think this course was extremely successful and I have greatly improved this year. There were many presentations, which were a lot of work but, in the end, paid off. I think more lectures in class would be helpful, I enjoyed learning as a collective group.
This course was great. I do not think there are any glaring weaknesses.
A lot of work everyday but there is also a lot of group work, so it is manageable.

I don't think the course had any weaknesses. The course was very well structured and organized outside and inside of the class. I knew all the time what to do long ahead and the workload was reasonably high to support my learning.

The course was excellent in that it forced you to improve in Spanish, mostly through immersion. It was very empowering being able to read texts and give presentations in another language. However, I felt that it was almost too text/presentation based, and could have benefited greatly from somehow incorporating more natural conversations.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes, my Spanish comprehension and expression have developed significantly this semester. This class is great for anyone who wants to learn a new language.
I would recommend this course, and this professor, 100%. If you are interested in practicing Spanish and receiving good/healthy/constructive feedback, this class is perfect for that.
It is helpful to get better at spanish but unless you love language the work is a lot

Yes I would definitely recommend this course to another student. This class was the perfect introduction to my language career at Yale. I learned the most I have ever learned in a language class and was extremely grateful for the helpful and encouraging feedback I received.
Yes, based on this course, I think the Yale Spanish department is very well-established.
Yes!
Yes, I would definitely recommend this class. The content is engaging, you learn about different cultures and countries while developing your Spanish skills.
Yes, this is a great course for getting better at Spanish!
